head.title: Shapes in Plaster for Just the Right Touch

hedline.hl1: Shapes in Plaster for Just the Right Touch

abstract.p: Brancusi-inspired collection of multiwax candles is designed by Anne Severine Liotard; hoto (S)

block.p: Anne Severine Liotard made her mark on decorating in 1994 with her Brancusi-inspired collection of multiwick wax candles, with their zigzagging columns and oversize circular or oval shapes. (Those sparked a candle mania, repercussions of which we still see in stores today.) What next? Ms. Liotard, a former fashion magazine editor, found the answer in smooth, sensual plaster forms in which art meets decoration. ''Plaster is volatile and ethereal, yet feminine and soft,'' she said. ''I love its whiteness.'' A fine sandpaper will rub out finger prints from hands that could not resist touching. From $1,150 to $1,800 at Galerie Joelle Mortier Valat, 13 rue des St. Peres; telephone, 011-33.1.42.60.28.30; fax, 011-33.1.42.60.28.16.
